newsitem.title: UK: UK brewer Ushers of T'bridge to float via placing.
newsitem.headline: UK brewer Ushers of T'bridge to float via placing.

text.p: Ushers of Trowbridge Group Plc, a regional brewer, said on Wednesday it plans to float on London Stock Exchange by means of a placing.
The proceeds from the placing, sponsored by Hambros Bank with Panmure Gordon as broker, will be used to reduce borrowing and fund expansion.
The group also said it had appointed Tom Vyner, deputy chairman of J. Sainsbury Plc, as non-executive chairman.
Publishing the pathfinder prospectus today, with the final prospectus scheduled for early March, chief executive Roger North expressed optimism about the group's future.
"Ushers' position as a vertically integrated regional brewer with an established specialist contract brewing activity offers us a wide range of opportunities for expansion," North said.
"The flotation will help us to take full advantage of these opportunities as they arise and we are optimistic about Ushers' prospects for continued growth."
